message.content:
<<<api>>>: Random
<<<code>>>: 
int rows = array.length;
int cols = array[0].length;
int totalItems = rows * cols;
int halfItems = totalItems / 2;
int countA = 0;
int countB = 0;

Random random = new Random();

for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) {
  for (int j = 0; j < cols; j++) {
    if (countA < halfItems && countB < halfItems) {
      int choice = random.nextInt(2);
      if (choice == 0) {
        array[i][j] = "A";
        countA++;
      } else {
        array[i][j] = "B";
        countB++;
      }
    } else if (countA < halfItems) {
      array[i][j] = "A";
      countA++;
    } else {
      array[i][j] = "B";
      countB++;
    }
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses the Random class to generate random choices between 0 and 1. It keeps track of the count of each choice (A and B) and ensures that there is an even split among the two choices by checking if the count of either choice has reached half of the total items. If not, it randomly selects a choice and increments the corresponding count. If one of the choices has reached half of the total items, it fills the remaining items with the other choice.
